channel.title: DDoS
channel.description: Is there any way to get an Anti-DDOS. Because I was recently DDoS'd and I have a Anti-Flood but DDoS is too strong

item.title: DDoS
item.dc:creator: @Pblord7 Pblord7
item.description:
@Pblord7 wrote:

He was TRYING to act cool

item.title: DDoS
item.dc:creator: @Cooldude170 Cooldude170
item.description:
@Cooldude170 wrote:

Liquid Magic:

Just play alone and don’t give anyone your server IP. That is a total anti-ddos system.

Why make a server to play alone?
And someone can always get your server IP with the magical ping command.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoS
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

This kind of thing is general knowledge in the RSC (rs classic) scene.

Summary: It will cost you $200+ p/m on top of a dedicated server ($150-250 p/m) for secureport (staminus). Other ways to block it won’t help your cause. This is the most affordable solution.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoS
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Pblord7, post:5, topic:366406”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=462604.msg3384220#msg3384220 date=1288309801]

I believe if you put a firewall in place it should stop it. Or buy for protection. Most companies should provide ddos protection.

Vpsland doesnt >.>

Oh, yeah. I used them, terrible service. I advice you talk to there customer support and sort something out.
[/quote]
They havent replyed… its been a day?[/quote]

Don’t be surprised, took them 4 days to setup my vps then they refunded me sigh. Also,

http://www.tutorial5.com/content/view/80/79/

Read full topic
